properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the annual italian festival held along Norton Street from 10am to 5pm. 

Traffic will be heavy in the area and on approach to Leichhardt including Parramatta Rd, City West Link Rd and Great Western Hwy. Motorists should allow extra travel time in the area and expect delays.

Roads will be closed from 3am to 9pm Norton St will be closed between Marion St and William St, and surrounding local roads including sections of Arthur St, Allen St, Short St and Wetherill St.

From 6am to 9pm sections of Allen Street, Carlisle St, Derbyshire Rd, Lou St, Macauley St, Marlborough Street will also be closed. Local access will be maintained through Macauley St and Wetherill St.

Special event clearways will be in effect along both sides of Norton St between Marion St and William St from 3am to 9pm. Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

From 3am to 9pm:

  • Norton Street between Marion Street and William Street
  • Allen Street between Derbyshire Road and Norton Street
  • Arthur Street between Allen Street and Short Street
  • Short Street between Norton Street and Balmain Road
  • Wetherill Street* between Norton Street and Balmain Road

* Vehicle access will be maintained to Wetherill St for local residents entry and exit via Derbyshire Rd.

 

From 6am to 9pm:

  • Allen Street between Norton Street and James Street
  • Carlisle Street between Norton Street and Cromwell Street
  • Derbyshire Road at William Street
  • Macauley Street* between Norton Street and Cromwell Street
  • Marlborough Street between Norton Street and Cromwell Street
  • Lou Street, parallel to Norton Street between Marion Street and Allen Street
  • Un-named lane off Short Street
  • * Vehicle access will be maintained to Macauley St for local residents entry and exit via Cromwell St


SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your car is towed, call the Traffic Information Line on 132 701 to find its new location.

LEICHHARDT - FROM 3AM TO 9PM

  • Norton St between Marion St and William St (both sides)

properties.otherAdvice: Vincent Street will be closed from Wollombi Rd to Hall St; Cooper St will be closed from Cumberland St to Charlton St and Charlton St will be closed from the North Charlton car park to 50m south of Cooper St.
properties.diversions:
Light Vehicle Detours:

Eastbound traffic on Wollombi Road will be detoured via Cumberland Street and Hall Street.

Westbound traffic on Wollombi Road will be detoured via Darwin Street and Hall Street.

Northbound traffic on Vincent Street will be detoured via Cumberland Street or Darwin Street.

Heavy Vehicle Detours:

Northbound heavy vehicles will be directed to detour via Aberdare Rd, South St, Darwin St and Wollombi Rd.

Southbound heavy vehicles will be directed to detour via Wollombi Rd, Darwin St, South St and Aberdare Rd.

properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting around the road closures. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures will be in place for the Marrickville Music Festival from 12.30am until midnight.

With large crowds expected traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the area while closures and detours are in place. Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.  

Road closures:

  • Marrickville Road between Illawarra Road and Victoria Rd.
  • Gladstone Street between Marrickville Rd and Marrickville Ln
  • Silver Street between Marrickville Rd and Sydenham Rd
  • Garners Ave between Marrickville Rd and Sydenham Rd
  • Seymour Ln between Garners Ave and Frampton Ave
  • Garners Ln from Seymour Ln

From 9.30am to 6pm closures will be in place on Central Ln between Victoria Rd and Meeks Rd and Victoria Ln between Central Ln and unnamed lane off Meeks Rd.

properties.publicTransport: Buses will be detouring around the closures and missing some stops. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney - Sydney Streets event on Glebe Point Rd. The event runs from 11am until 10pm.

  • Glebe Point Rd will be closed between Broadway and St Johns Rd from 9am to 11:30pm.
  • Sections of Norton St, Mitchell St, Cowper St, Derby Pl and Francis St will also be closed during this time.
  • Motorists can detour around the closures via St Johns Rd and Derwent St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Glebe Point Rd, Francis St, Derby Pl, Coweper St, Norton St and Mitchell St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee apply

Melbourne Cup at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race from 11:40am, last race at 5:40pm. Concert start from 5:55pm

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as attendees travel to and from racecourse. Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Special event clearways will be in effect at the following times and locations:

  • 4am – 7pm: Darley Road between Alison Road and Centennial Park round-a-bout (western side)
  • 8am – 7pm: Ascot Street between Doncaster Avenue and Randwick Racecourse Ascot Street entry (both sides)
  • 3pm – 7pm: High Street between UNSW Gate 2 and Anzac Parade (southern side)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney - Sydney Streets event on Darlinghurst Rd. The event runs from 11am until 10pm.

  • Sections of Macleay St, Orwell St and Roslyn St will also be closed during this time.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Darlinghurst Rd, Elizabeth Bay Rd, Macleay St, Orwell St, Ward Ave and Roslyn St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applyDarlin

properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 10,000 cyclists will ride from Sydney to Fairy Meadow for the 40th annual MS Gong Ride. The 79km ride from Tempe Recreation Reserve starts from 6am and the 52km ride will start at Preston Park, Engadine from 8am. Both events finish at Thomas Dalton Park in Fairy Meadow by 4pm.

Road and lane closures will be in place along sections of the course.

  • 4am to 9:30am from Tempe to Sutherland: sections of West Botany St, Holbeach Ave and Bestic St. The speed limit will be reduced to 60/km along Rocky Point Rd/Taren Point Rd from Sans Souci to Taren Point.
  • 5am to 9:30am from Sutherland to Waterfall: Lane closures on the Princes Hwy from Kirrawee to Loftus and the speed limit will be reduced to 60km/h from Kirrawee to Waterfall. Delays are expected travelling southbound on the Princes Hwy during this time. 
  • 5am to 2:30pm in the Royal National Park: McKell Ave, Lady Wakehurst Dr, Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Otford Rd. Access to the Royal National Park is via Farnell Ave only.
  • 5am to 4.30pm in Fairy Meadow: sections of Elliotts Rd near the finish area will be closed. The speed limit will be reduced to 40km/h along Lawrence Hargrave Dr from Stanwell Park to Thirroul from 6am to 3pm.

Motorists should exercise caution as cyclists will be sharing some roads along the course. Motorists are reminded when overtaking cyclists to leave a 1.5m distance on roads with speed limits over 60km/h and a 1m distance on roads 60km/h or under.

Special event clearways will be in place along key sections of the course between 4am and 3pm. Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed it will be relocated to the nearest legal parking space, use the Find My Car website or call 132 701 to find its new location.

A-League Men: Western Sydney Wanderers v Central Coast Mariners at CommBank Stadium. Kick off from 7:45pm and full-time around 9:40pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

The annual Orange NAIDOC Week Street March will take place on Monday 31 October between 10:30am and 11:00am. Summer St (Mitchell Hwy) will be closed between Sale St and Robertson Park (McNamara Ln).

Motorists are advised to avoid the area, follow the direction of signage and drive to the conditions.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

properties.otherAdvice:
ICC T20 Men's Cricket World Cup: Pakistan v South Africa at the Sydney Cricket Ground. Gates Open: 5pm, Start: 7pm, Finish: 10:10pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park on Thursday evening including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium before the match and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access EP2 Kippax car park from Moore Park Rd, or from the Eastern Distributor use the Bondi exit. Access EP3 southern grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd, from the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until midnight including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Chalmers St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney Sydney Streets event in Haymarket. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

  • Hay St will be closed in both directions between Sussex St and Harbour St from 9am until 11:30pm.
  • Sections of Harbour St, Sussex St, Little Hay St, Factory St, Kimber Ln and Little Pier St will also be closed during this time.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Hay St, Harbour St, Sussex St and Little Hay St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee apply

properties.otherAdvice:
ICC T20 Men's Cricket World Cup: New Zealand v Sri Lanka at the Sydney Cricket Ground. Gates Open: 5:30pm, Start: 7pm, Finish: 10:10pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd, particularly ahead of the evening match.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium before the match and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access EP2 Kippax car park from Moore Park Rd, or from the Eastern Distributor use the Bondi exit. Access EP3 southern grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd, from the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until midnight including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Chalmers St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.otherAdvice:
Oktoberfest in the Gardens at the Domain from 1pm to 9pm.

Thousands of revellers are expected at Australia’s biggest Oktoberfest celebration when it returns to Sydney at the Phillip Precinct in The Domain.

Traffic will be heavier than usual in the Sydney CBD on approaches to the Domain. Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time and watch out for pedestrians in the area.

A dedicated drop off zone will be located on Hospital Rd at Art Gallery Rd.

roads.mainStreet: Macquarie St, Prince Albert Rd, College St, Art Gallery Rd

properties.publicTransport: Buses will run frequently between the city, Bondi Junction and Bondi Beach. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

properties.otherAdvice:
Sculpture by the Sea returns to the Bondi to Tamarama coastal walk from Friday 21 October to Monday 7 November. Local road closures will be in place each day of the event from 7:30am to 6:30pm.

Significant delays are expected on roads approaching the area during the event, particularly on weekends. Motorists should avoid the area where possible or allow plenty of extra travel time on Bondi Road, Old South Head Road and Syd Einfeld Drive approaching Bondi Beach. 

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect along both sides of Bondi Road each weekend of the event on Saturday 22 and Sunday 23 October, Saturday 29 and Sunday 30 October, and Saturday 5 and Sunday 6 November:

  • 7am to 2pm: Bondi Rd from Oxford St at Bondi Junction to Sandridge St at Bondi Beach.
  • 12pm midday to 8pm: Bondi Rd from Sandridge St at Bondi Beach to Oxford St at Bondi Junction.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed it will be relocated to the nearest legal parking space, use the Find My Car website or call 132 701 to find its new location.

arrangementElements.title: Road closures & Changed traffic conditions

properties.diversions:
The New England Hwy will be closed between John St and King St from 10.30am to 11am for the event.

Detour via John Street, Maitland Street and King Street for the duration of the closure. This detour is suitable for all vehicles, including B-doubles. OSOM vehicles will not be permitted on the detour and will be held until the road is re-opened.

properties.publicTransport: Race day tickets include travel on public trans﻿port. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Golden Eagle Race Day - The Everest Carnival at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. Gates Open: 10:30am First race at 12:05pm, last race at 6:10pm, Concert: 6:20pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Central Coast Mariners v Western United FC. Game start 5:15pm. Finish at approx 7:15pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will be closed between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St from 3:15pm and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Illawarra Hawks v Melbourne United. Tip-off from 5:30pm, full time around 7pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game.

Sections of Harbour St at the Stadium will be closed for crowd safety. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Macarthur FC v Sydney FC at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Start from 7:45pm, finish approx 9:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Sydney Kings v Cairns Taipans at Qudos Bank Arena. Tip off from 7:45pm, finish around 10pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.Cairns Taipans
